videoData.title: Protecting privacy at Twitter

nodes.whatOthersSay: One of the projects Harvey is most keen on is called PhotoDNA – a Microsoft-developed technology which will produce a unique 'fingerprint' of every picture put on Twitter's service.
nodes.whoTheyAre: Del Harvey works to define policy and to ensure user safety and security in the challenging realm of modern social media.
nodes.whyListen: As Senior Director of Trust and Safety at Twitter, Del Harvey works to define policy and to ensure user safety and security in the challenging realm of modern social media. Prior to joining Twitter, she spent five years as the co-administrator and law enforcement liaison for a 501(c)3 non-profit charity, working with agencies ranging from local police departments to the FBI, U.S. Marshals and the Secret Service.

videoData.description: Twitter's Head of Safety, Del Harvey, shares what she's learned about protecting users' privacy on a platform where activity grows by the billions every two days. Through her funny and insightful anecdotes, she paints a picture of what it's like to oversee a community where a one-in-a-million chance is pretty good odds.
videoData.socialDescription: Twitter's Head of Safety, Del Harvey, shares what she's learned about protecting users' privacy on a platform where activity grows by the billions every two days. Through her funny and insightful anecdotes, she paints a picture of what it's like to oversee a community where a one-in-a-million chance is pretty good odds.
